Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_hire.model.application

Class Application

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_hire.model.application.Application
  • public class Application
extends java.lang.Object
    Concrete class that implements and represents the context of WolfHire's State Pattern. This class creates, stores, and manages all of the information for an Application object, which includes its current state. An Application object knows its id, first name, surname, unity id, (optional) reviewer, and (optional) note. The Application's state is updated when a Command encapsulating the specified transition is issued by the user. Application class encapsulates the ApplicationState interface and seven concrete *State classes that represent each of the seven possible state transitions in WolfHire's FSM.
    Author:
    hmreese2

    • Constructor Detail

      • Application

        public Application​(java.lang.String firstName,
                   java.lang.String surname,
                   java.lang.String unityId)
        Basic (starter) constructor for Application that constructs an application with only firstName, surname, and unityId fields. A new application starts in the SUBMITTED state, both reviewer and note values are null. Application's fields are set by calling to the full Application constructor, where id is passed as counter, state as SUBMITTED, and reviewer/note fields as null.
        Parameters:
        firstName - first name of applicant
        surname - surname of applicant
        unityId - unity id of applicant
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with message "Application cannot be created." if any parameters are invalid (i.e. if any are null or empty strings)

      • Application

        public Application​(int id,
                   java.lang.String state,
                   java.lang.String firstName,
                   java.lang.String surname,
                   java.lang.String unityId,
                   java.lang.String reviewer,
                   java.lang.String note)
        Longer (full) constructor for Application that constructs with id, state, first/last name, unity id, reviewer, and note fields. If the incoming id is greater than the current value in counter, then counter should be updated to id+1 using setCounter(id) method. If incoming id is less than counter, applicationId is set to value of id parameter. If if is equal to counter, counter is incremented using incrementCounter(). Shorter constructor calls to this constructor to complete application construction (if necessary).
        Parameters:
        id - if of application
        state - state of application
        firstName - first name of applicant
        surname - surname of applicant
        unityId - unity id of applicant
        reviewer - reviewer for application
        note - note for application
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with message "Application cannot be created." if any parameters are invalid

        public static void incrementCounter()
        Increments counter variable. Used for updating list placement.

      • setCounter

        public static void setCounter​(int newCount)
        Sets value for counter variable to newCount. Updates counter to id + 1 if id is greater than counter.
        Parameters:
        newCount - value being set to counter

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns application information as a formatted string representation of the information. If reviewer or note are null they should be changed to empty string values in the return statement.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string representation of application object's information

      • update

        public void update​(Command c)
        Command issued to application to update its state placement in the FSM.
        Parameters:
        c - command given to application
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - with message "Invalid command." if transition is invalid with given command
